intro: Psychotria consanguinea, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Andean Coca," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect or semi-woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves contain alkaloids, particularly cocaine, which have been historically used for medicinal and stimulant purposes. Psychotria consanguinea thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, humid environments.
